text.0: let me not yet king varuṇa enter into the house of clay.
text.1: have mercy spare me mighty lord.
text.2: when thunderer i move along tremulous like a windblown skin.
text.3: have mercy spare me mighty lord.
text.4: o bright and powerful god through want of strength i erred and went astray.
text.5: have mercy spare me mighty lord.
text.6: thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of waterfijods.
text.7: have mercy spare me mighty lord.
text.8: o varuṇa whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host.
text.9: when through our want of thought we violate thy laws punish us not o god for that iniquity.
